page.title: 02Lower Largo
page.content: The coastal settlement of Lower Largo is sited on one of the areas many raised beaches at a height of around 15m.It's population is approximately 600 but this rises significantly with the tourist trade in summer. The settlement was established firstly as a small fishing port around the natural harbour formed by a stream entering the Firth of Forth at this point.Currently the harbour area is used mainly for yachts and the importance of fishing and related industries has diminished. The developement of Lower Largo as a tourist spot has centred on it's attractive sandy shoreline which offers safe bathing,a caravan site nearby, possibilities for water sports such as windsurfing an sailing .r
